category: news
title: "Will Floating Point 8 Solve AI/ML Overhead?"
excerpt: "IEEE 754 describes how the radix point (more commonly known in English as the “decimal” point) doesn’t have a fixed position, but rather “floats” where needed in the expression. It allows numbers with extremely long streams of digits (whether originally to the left or right of a fixed point) to fit into the limited bit-space of computers."
